Short-term Insurance.title: Santam 2025 Insurance Barometer highlights ongoing socioeconomic, infrastructure and climate change risks
Short-term Insurance.snippet: Santam's 2025 Insurance Barometer Report reveals that economic challenges, crime, infrastructure risks, and climate change are major concerns impacting South African households and businesses.  The report highlights the need for the short-term insurance industry to adapt and innovate.

Motor Insurance.title: Motorists face claim rejections over poor car maintenance
Motor Insurance.snippet: Motorists are being warned that failing to maintain their vehicles could result in their short-term insurance claims being rejected - leaving them to foot the bill after an accident.

Home Insurance.title: Climate change cuts through the insurance value chain
Home Insurance.snippet: Brokers play an integral role in helping insureds navigate evolving climate change related risks by giving practical guidance on risk mitigation and transfer and offering support when extreme weather events disrupt businesses and households.

Personal Accident Insurance.title: Santam 2025 Insurance Barometer highlights ongoing socioeconomic, infrastructure and climate change risks
Personal Accident Insurance.snippet: Santam's 2025 Insurance Barometer Report highlights the challenges impacting South African households and businesses, including economic environment, crime, infrastructure risks, and climate change.  The report notes that short-term insurance remains a low priority for consumers looking to cut expenses.

Liability Insurance.title: VAT hikes, trade shocks and the short-term insurance squeeze
Liability Insurance.snippet: The short-term insurance industry is facing increased pressure from two directions: proposed domestic tax hikes and global trade uncertainty. Taken together, these developments are likely to deepen financial strain on policyholders while simultaneously threatening the growth and stability of the insurance sector itself.

Liability Insurance.title: The risk of inaction: addressing SA's short-term insurance crisis
Liability Insurance.snippet: South Africa faces a rising shortfall in short-term risk protection, particularly for natural disasters. The 2022 KwaZulu-Natal floods exposed the extent of this gap, with the Santam Insurance Barometer Report 2022/23 estimating total economic damage at R54 billion - yet only half of this amount was covered by insurance.

Insurance News.title: Insuring smart commercial growth for SA businesses
Insurance News.snippet: PSG Insure's Ryno de Kock stresses the importance of aligning short-term insurance with business growth. As companies expand, tailored cover for assets, liability and business interruption becomes critical to mitigate risks, ensure continuity and support long-term sustainable growth.

Insurance News.title: Competitive Pricing Wins South Africans' Loyalty to Short-Term Insurers
Insurance News.snippet: Nearly six in ten (59%) South Africans shopped around for a better car insurance deal in the first six months of 2024. Cheaper premiums and better coverage were the leading reasons that consumers switched car insurers.

Insurance News.title: Understanding short-term insurance habits
Insurance News.snippet: South Africans choose to prioritise short-term insurance.  Eighty20, South Africa's leading consumer insights and data science firm, analyses the South African short-term insurance (STI) sector.

Santam.title: Santam achieves strong H1 performance for 2025 financial year
Santam.snippet: Santam, South Africa's largest short-term insurer, has delivered a strong first-half performance, exceeding the long-term targets for all key performance indicators for the 2025 financial year.

Hollard Insurance.title: The Latest Hollard Media Centre News & Articles
Hollard Insurance.snippet: Lumkani, Hollard and Zibonele FM step up to support fire victims. Following a fire that tore through the Mangaung informal settlement in Lower Crossroads, Lumkani partnered with Hollard and Zibonele FM to offer support.

Discovery Insure.title: SA Women retire with 21% less than men, says new data from Discovery Corporate and Employee Benefits
Discovery Insure.snippet: Beyond the pay gap, systemic bias, financial pressures and family caregiving commitments compound to create a deeper retirement crisis for women.

MiWay.title: Miway achieves one of the industry-leading overturn ratios of 6%, in latest ombud report
MiWay.snippet: Miway has recorded one of the lowest overturn ratios (also referred to as resolved ratio) across the short-term insurance industry at just 6%, according to the recently released National Financial Ombud Scheme South Africa (NFO) 2024 Annual Report.

OUTsurance.title: OUTsurance went from challenger to champion
OUTsurance.snippet: OUTsurance has emerged as the dominant player in South Africa's short-term insurance market, with it now setting its sights on global expansion in Australia and Ireland.

Financial Sector Conduct Authority (FSCA.title: FSCA enforcement penalties eye R1 billion
Financial Sector Conduct Authority (FSCA.snippet: It has been a bumper year for the enforcement team at the Financial Sector Conduct Authority (FSCA) with almost R1 billion in penalties imposed on 33 persons.

Insurance Act.title: Short-term Insurance Act 53 of 1998
Insurance Act.snippet: The Short-term Insurance Act 53 of 1998 intends: to provide for the registration of short-term insurers; for the control of certain activities of short-term insurers and intermediaries; and for matters connected therewith.

Insurance Act.title: FSCA to exempt non-life brokers from clawbacks when a policy is voided because of non-disclosure
Insurance Act.snippet: The FSCA has proposed amending the Short-term Insurance Act regulations to exempt independent intermediaries from commission clawbacks when a policy is voided because of material misrepresentation or non-disclosure by the policyholder.

Insurance Act.title: FSCA fines Kings and Lamers R1.1m
Insurance Act.snippet: The Financial Sector Conduct Authority (FSCA) has fined Kings and Lamers R1.1 million for contraventions of the Short-term Insurance Act.

Regulatory Compliance.title: The risk of inaction: addressing SA's short-term insurance crisis
Regulatory Compliance.snippet: South Africa faces a rising shortfall in short-term risk protection, particularly for natural disasters. The 2022 KwaZulu-Natal floods exposed this gap, with only half of the estimated R54 billion in economic damage covered by insurance.  The lack of coverage disproportionately impacts vulnerable populations due to high living costs and a lack of knowledge about insurance benefits.

Insurance Ombudsman.title: Why policyholders complained to the short-term ombudsman in 2023
Insurance Ombudsman.snippet: Policy exclusions were the top reason for disputes between insurers and policyholders in 2023, according to the Ombudsman for Short-term Insurance (OSTI) annual report.  The OSTI saw a 5.6% increase in complaints, totaling 12,188, with motor vehicle accidents being the most common issue.  The resolved ratio was 16%, and the average turnaround time was 97 days.

Short-term Insurance Claims.title: South African Short-Term Insurance Claims Rise Amidst Economic Uncertainty
Short-term Insurance Claims.snippet: Recent data reveals a surge in short-term insurance claims in South Africa, attributed to factors such as increased vehicle theft and rising inflation.
